headline: BlackRock COO looking to improve tech, AI capabilities
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -BlackRock Inc, the world's largest asset manager, is looking for opportunities to expand its technology capabilities including in the area of artificial intelligence, its chief operating officer said on Tuesday.  "There's always pockets of capabilities that you can improve upon," said BlackRock COO Rob Goldstein, speaking in an interview at the Reuters NEXT conference in New York.  Goldstein pointed to particular opportunities in AI.

Goldstein pointed to particular opportunities in AI.

headline: BlackRock sees investor shift from cash after even 'modest' rate cuts
summary: Investors are expected to increase their allocations to stocks and bonds from cash after even "modest" Federal Reserve interest rate cuts, BlackRock's chief financial officer said on Tuesday.  Expectations earlier this year that the U.S. central bank would cut interest rates aggressively after hiking them to fight inflation have moderated in recent months as the U.S. economy continues to show momentum despite high borrowing costs.  "I think even modest rate cuts are going to fuel a very healthy amount of investor re-risking," said BlackRock CFO Martin Small, speaking at the Goldman Sachs U.S. Financial Services conference on Tuesday.

headline: Now You Can Avoid Taxes Like the Rich and Famous
summary: Technology such as AI widens access to tax-optimization strategies, including the launch of funds that explicitly seek to defer tax payments.
